I told you this morning: with every slight dip in BTC, everyone rushes to short... and bam, liquidation.

Stop shorting as soon as it dips! You're getting burned every time.

$SOL  defended the 122‚Äì124 Double Bottom zone and shot up from Bottom 2 to hit the neckline resistance at 143‚Äì144! Now the chart is pressing against the same neckline that has capped every breakout attempt over the past two weeks. This is the key decision point: momentum either carries #Solana  through 144 with strength, or we get another reaction that forces price back into the mid-range.  From here, partial take-profit into the neckline is a sensible approach, and the rest can trail only if we see a clean, strong close above 144. If price rejects again, the next high-probability area sits around 136‚Äì138.

The Vanguard pivot and rising Fed rate-cut expectations combined to flip ETF flows, USDT, and macro sentiment into a coordinated risk-on day.
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Market Summary
 „ÉªBTC staged a sharp rebound, briefly reclaiming the 92,000 USD area. Gold sold off while stocks and BTC were bought, signaling a textbook risk-on rotation.
 „ÉªOver the last 24 hours, short liquidations took the lead, with roughly 140M USD in shorts wiped out in just one hour at the peak ‚Äì a mechanical short squeeze that mirrored, but reversed, the prior long-wipeout move.
 „ÉªVanguard fully enabled trading of spot crypto ETFs, opening access to BTC, ETH, XRP, and SOL ETFs to over 50 million clients. This is effectively the ‚Äúsecond act‚Äù of the ETF cycle.
 „ÉªBlackRock‚Äôs spot BTC ETF (IBIT) surpassed 1.8B USD in trading volume within just two hours of the session open, confirming that both retail and institutional demand via ETFs remain very strong.
 „ÉªAt the same time, a fresh 1B USD of USDT was minted, a major positive for liquidity and potential new buying power.
 „ÉªETH reclaimed the 3,000 USD handle; if it breaks above the upper boundary of the rising wedge, analysts see 3,550‚Äì4,000 USD as a possible target zone into year-end / early next year.
 „ÉªAs Pelin Ay notes, ETH balances on exchanges ‚Äì especially Binance ‚Äì keep trending lower. Supply is tightening on-chain, order books are thin, and even modest demand can move price.
 „ÉªRussia‚Äôs move toward easing crypto regulations, the European banking consortium ‚ÄúQivalis‚Äù preparing a euro stablecoin, and TrustWallet rolling out prediction markets all added constructive headlines on the regulation and infrastructure front.
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
On-Chain & Technical Trends
 „ÉªBTC‚Äôs on-chain ‚Äúshort-term trader cohort‚Äù (1‚Äì3 month holders) has entered the deepest ‚Äúpain zone‚Äù of this cycle, with a realized price around 113,692 USD and two straight weeks of 20‚Äì25% realized losses. This is textbook capitulation behavior.
 „ÉªIn past cycles, similar phases have often coincided with bottom formation. After a wave of forced selling from these traders, conditions frequently become attractive for long-term accumulators ‚Äì assuming the long-term bullish trend remains intact.
 „ÉªMaartunn‚Äôs data shows Net Taker Volume (25-hour MA) at +50M USD, the highest since October 2. This signals a transition from derivatives-driven whipsaws toward spot and taker buying leading the move.
 „ÉªCW‚Äôs analysis suggests whales are building a sell wall around 98,000 USD. However, once price breaks through this zone, upside resistance thins out significantly, creating a ‚Äúbreak and run‚Äù structure.
 „ÉªETH‚Äôs exchange supply continues to fall as coins are withdrawn and staked. Several valuation models still flag ETH as ‚Äúundervalued,‚Äù leaving room for an extended upside move if demand persists.
 „ÉªWhile some analysts highlight a recent slowdown in USDT inflows, the latest large mint points to a renewed improvement in the liquidity backdrop.
 „ÉªMicroStrategy, with 650k BTC plus 1.44B USD in cash, has floated the idea of eventually lending out part of its BTC stack ‚Äì a potential new revenue leg and an expansion of balance-sheet-driven on-chain demand.
 „ÉªThe rapid growth of prediction markets like Polymarket and Kalshi, plus TrustWallet‚Äôs new Predictions feature, adds a fresh layer of on-chain speculation and hedging use-cases, broadening the crypto ecosystem beyond simple spot and leverage.
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Sentiment
 „ÉªAfter extreme fear just a day ago, sentiment flipped quickly as ‚ÄúFed cut odds at 91%,‚Äù ‚ÄúVanguard all-in,‚Äù and ‚ÄúETF volume explosion‚Äù hit the tape together, driving a fast pivot back toward risk-on.
 „ÉªCW is urging: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt doubt the bull market!‚Äù and emphasizing that whales kept accumulating BTC during the drawdown. The narrative of ‚Äúonly leveraged players are hurting; large, patient buyers are fine‚Äù is gaining traction.
 „ÉªAt the same time, Ash Crypto warns that syndicates are actively hunting both longs and shorts, engineering liquidations on both sides. This keeps caution elevated around high leverage and short-term trading.
 „ÉªKobeissi Letter highlights a sharp drop in US consumer confidence, underscoring a widening ‚ÄúK-shaped‚Äù economic divide. Real-world stress is rising even as markets lean into a bullish narrative, widening the gap between macro reality and asset prices.
 „ÉªBank of America‚Äôs view that wealthy clients can consider allocating up to 4% of their portfolios to crypto formalizes digital assets as a ‚Äúlegitimate‚Äù asset class in mainstream wealth management.
 „ÉªTrump‚Äôs comments that ‚Äúincome tax will disappear‚Äù in the near future and that the Fed ‚Äúshould cut next week‚Äù add a layer of political noise ‚Äì fueling both speculative hope and expectations for volatility.
 „ÉªHeadlines like ‚Äúthe world‚Äôs highest-IQ person declares the bull market has begun‚Äù are spreading on social media, mixing FOMO with skepticism ‚Äì classic late-cycle emotional swings, even if the data still points to room to run.
 „ÉªOverall, the Fear & Greed dynamic is transitioning from ‚ÄúFear ‚Üí Neutral ‚Üí Greed.‚Äù More traders are now positioning for a two-stage upside move driven by short squeezes plus ETF-led inflows.
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
US Legacy Markets
 „ÉªFor the next Fed meeting, the probability of a rate cut has surged to 91% on Polymarket. Markets are increasingly pricing in a full easing cycle running into 2026.
 „ÉªSEC Chair Paul Atkins stated that regulators are ‚Äúmoving forward in the crypto space‚Äù and ‚Äúseeking to embrace this new innovation,‚Äù adding to the positive regulatory momentum alongside the removal of SAB 121 and greater room for banks/brokers to participate.
 „ÉªBank of America‚Äôs ‚Äúup to 4% allocation‚Äù stance for crypto is a milestone for integrating digital assets into classic portfolio theory for HNW clients.
 „ÉªFord‚Äôs ongoing EV sales slowdown and potential scale-back of the F-150 EV line highlight the challenges of an all-EV growth story and may push some capital toward other high-growth themes like AI and crypto.
 „ÉªBig Tech‚Äôs escalating AI arms race, with Amazon jumping in more aggressively, continues to drive tech equity valuations and reinforces risk-on sentiment across growth assets.
 „ÉªTrump‚Äôs signal that the next Fed Chair nomination will come ‚Äúearly next year‚Äù keeps political risk in play, while markets quietly price in a more dovish successor.
